name: SendMessage
description: Sends a message to an SNS topic or SQS queue
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Amazon Simple Queue Service](https://aws.amazon.com/documentation/sqs/) and [Amazon Simple Notification Service](https://aws.amazon.com/documentation/sns/) documentation for working with these services.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the AWS credentials to use. If needed, click on 'Manage', and add a new Service Endpoint of type 'AWS'.

inputs.name: messageTarget
inputs.label: Message Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: The destination for the message. A message can be sent to a Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic or a Simple Queue Service (SQS) queue.

inputs.name: message
inputs.label: Message
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The message content to send.

The maximum size for both queue and topic targets is 256KB (262144 bytes, not 262144 characters).

inputs.name: topicArn
inputs.label: Topic ARN
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SNS topic to which the message will be sent.

inputs.name: queueUrl
inputs.label: Queue Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of the Amazon SQS queue to which the message will be sent.

inputs.name: delaySeconds
inputs.label: Delay (seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The length of time, in seconds, for which to delay a specific message. Valid values: 0 to 900. Maximum: 15 minutes. Messages with a positive DelaySeconds value become available for processing after the delay period is finished. If you don't specify a value, the default value for the queue applies.

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set the request data sent to AWS service calls is output to the task's debug log.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If set the body data of non-streaming responses returned by AWS service calls are output to the task's debug log.

messages.SendingToQueueWithDelay: Sending message, with delay %s seconds, to queue %s
